description: Abbreviation of quadrangle; originally (17th century) referring to the quadrangles of Newgate Prison, London.

entries.meaning: (countable) A quadrangle or court, as of a prison; a prison.
examples: […] not the poorer classes merely, but the rich will be desirous to enjoy the mingled luxury and comfort of a gaol: and we shall hear of blasé Swells become burglars and garotters as a prelude to a prison, and, instead of taking tours for restoration of their health, recruiting it more cheaply by a residence in quod.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, Australia, slang) Confinement in a prison.
examples: I don′t suppose you'll get more than a couple of months′ quod for them.

verbs.description: quod (third-person singular simple present quods, present participle quodding, simple past and past participle quodded)

examples: “No fors,” quod he, “but tel me al youre grief.”
